properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. Heavy rain will begin Tuesday morning over West Vancouver Island. Total rainfall amounts in excess of 100 mm are expected by Tuesday evening. Yet another frontal system will move across Vancouver Island on Tuesday. This system will bring heavy rain and strong winds to West Vancouver Island beginning Tuesday morning. The heaviest rainfall rates are expected through the afternoon and early evening. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-05T10:28:47-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-04T18:28:47-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3218997012.2021
Area: West Vancouver Island
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow is expected or occurring in some locations. Winds near 60 km/h over the RIchardson Mountains are giving reduced visibility in blowing snow. Conditions are forecast to improve later this afternoon when the winds weaken. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Strong southeasterly winds of 70 to 90 km/h winds expected Tuesday. An approaching frontal system will spread very strong winds to Vancouver Island and the Sunshine Coast Tuesday. Winds will rise late Tuesday morning and persist into Tuesday evening. The strongest winds are expected over exposed coastal sections near the Strait of Georgia, Haro Strait, and the Southern Gulf Islands. Winds are expected to ease behind the frontal system Tuesday night. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-05T10:30:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-04T18:30:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2015414257.2021
Area: East Vancouver Island - Duncan to Nanaimo, East Vancouver Island - Nanoose Bay to Fanny Bay, East Vancouver Island - Courtenay to Campbell River, Greater Victoria, Sunshine Coast - Gibsons to Earls Cove, Sunshine Coast - Saltery Bay to Powell River, Southern Gulf Islands

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A prolonged period of mixed winter weather expected for the latter half of this week. Locations: Eastern and southeastern Labrador, as well as the Upper Lake Melville area. Time span: Beginning Wednesday morning and lasting into the weekend. The end time is uncertain at this point. Details for Wednesday: Snow, ice pellets, freezing and rain will affect southeastern Labrador and the Upper Lake Melville area. Snowfall amounts will range from 10 to 20 cm inland by Thursday morning, with rainfall amounts of 10 to 20 mm along the coast. A significant area of freezing rain is likely inland as well. Details for Thursday to Sunday: All above mentioned forms of precipitation will continue through Thursday and likely Friday as well, with significant amounts of each. At this time it looks as if conditions will begin to improve in some areas on Saturday, but may continue in other areas into Sunday. Further details will be provided in subsequent messages, as it is too soon to accurately forecast amounts and duration of precipitation due to uncertainty. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-05T11:44:56-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-04T19:44:56-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2480905864.2021
Area: Red Bay to L'Anse-au-Clair, Norman Bay to Lodge Bay, Cartwright to Black Tickle, Rigolet and vicinity, Postville - Makkovik, Upper Lake Melville, Eagle River

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Southeast winds of 80 to 100 km/h are expected over West Vancouver Island Tuesday. Strong winds will develop Tuesday morning and persist through the afternoon as a frontal system approaches Vancouver Island. The winds will ease Tuesday evening. ### High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow combined with strong winds will reduce visibilities to near zero over these areas beginning this evening. Weather conditions will improve Tuesday morning. A blizzard warning is issued when winds are expected to produce blowing snow with widespread visibilities of 400 metres or less for at least 6 hours. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-05T12:14:10-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-04T20:14:10-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0560619604.2021
Area: Akulivik, Puvirnituq

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of very cold wind chills is expected. Temperatures near minus 40 C combined with winds of 20 km/h are combining to create wind chills near minus 55 this morning. Wind chill values will moderate slightly this afternoon however values may return to warning levels again tonight. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 20 cm is expected. A frontal system moving across the BC Interior will bring snow to the North Columbia and Kinbasket regions today and tonight . Heavy snow from the system will continue through this evening with total accumulations up to 20 cm expected before the snow tapers off to a few flurries overnight. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Very strong wind gusts that may cause damage are expected or occurring. A strong pacific front will approach Haida Gwaii overnight and cross the archipelago Tuesday morning. Very strong winds will accompany the front and spread to all coastal regions of the BC North Coast on Tuesday. Winds will increase to southeast 90 to 120 km/h over Haida Gwaii early Tuesday morning and ease to south 40 to 60 km/h near noon. Winds will rise to southeast 90 km/h gusting to 110 over the exposed areas of North Vancouver Island, Central Coast- Coastal and North Coast - Coastal regions on Tuesday morning and ease to south 50 km/h late in the afternoon. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-05T09:43:30-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-04T17:43:30-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2830760827.2021
Area: Haida Gwaii, North Vancouver Island, Central Coast - coastal sections, North Coast - coastal sections
